sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"相同的"之意。
means: same ： 可指相同的人或物，也可指在质量、外表或意义等方面相同，但实际上有差别的事物。
identical ： 着重指人或物等在每细节上都完全相同。
very ： 侧重指完全同一，没有区别。
equal ： 多指在价值等方面相当而不相同的事物。
equivalent ： 主要指有同样价值、效力或意义的两种不同的事物。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个副词均可表示"大，很"之意。
means: too ： 指超过了承受能力或程度，即程度加到了不适当的地步。
very ： 用于加强程度，可修饰褒义词和贬义词。

entry.def: Very is used to give emphasis to an adjective or adverb.
entry.tran: 很，非常（用于修饰形容词或副词，表示强调）

example.ex: The problem and the answer are very simple...
example.tran: 问题和答案都非常简单。

example.ex: It is very, very strong evidence indeed...
example.tran: 这的确是非常非常有力的证据。

entry.def: Not very is used with an adjective or adverb to say that something is not at all true, or that it is true only to a small degree.

example.ex: She's not very impressed with them...
example.tran: 她对他们没什么印象。

example.ex: I'm not very good at explaining myself...
example.tran: 我不太善于为自己辩解。

entry.def: You use very to give emphasis to an adjective that is not usually graded, when you want to say that a quality is very obvious.

example.ex: Janet looked very pregnant...
example.tran: 珍妮特看上去显然是怀孕了。

example.ex: His taste strikes the English as very French...
example.tran: 他的品位让英国人觉得他是个地道的法国人。

entry.def: You use very to give emphasis to a superlative adjective or adverb. For example, if you say that something is the very best, you are emphasizing that it is the best.
entry.tran: 完全，最（用于修饰形容词或副词最高级,表示强调）

example.ex: They will be helped by the very latest in navigation aids...
example.tran: 他们将会受益于最新的导航系统。

example.ex: I am feeling in the very best of spirits...
example.tran: 我感觉自己的精神状态绝佳。

entry.def: You use very with certain nouns in order to specify an extreme position or extreme point in time.
entry.tran: （与某些名词连用，以确指最远的某一位置或时点）极端的

example.ex: At the very back of the yard, several feet from Lenny, was a wooden shack...
example.tran: 在院子的最后面离伦尼几英尺远的地方有一个小木屋。

example.ex: I turned to the very end of the book, to read the final words...
example.tran: 我翻到书的最后一页去读最后的文字。

entry.def: You use very with nouns to emphasize that something is exactly the right one or exactly the same one.

example.ex: Everybody says he is the very man for the case...
example.tran: 每个人都说他是接手这个案子的最佳人选。

example.ex: She died in this very house...
example.tran: 她正是在这间屋子里死去的。

entry.def: You use very with nouns to emphasize the importance or seriousness of what you are saying.
entry.tran: （与名词连用，强调重要性或严重性）仅仅的，唯独的，甚至于，就连

example.ex: At one stage his very life was in danger...
example.tran: 他的生命都曾一度处于危险之中。

example.ex: The very basis of Indian politics has been transformed...
example.tran: 甚至于印度的政治基础都被改变了。

entry.def: Very good is used to tell someone in authority that you agree to carry out a suggestion or order.
entry.tran: 好的，是（用于表示对上级的指示或命令遵照执行）

example.ex: 'Now give me some account of your voyage.' — 'Very good, sir.'
example.tran: “现在给我讲述一下你的航程吧。”——“非常乐意，先生。”

entry.def: The expression very much so is an emphatic way of answering 'yes' to something or saying that it is true or correct.

example.ex: 'Are you enjoying your holiday?' — 'Very much so.'
example.tran: “你的假期过得愉快吗？”——“非常愉快。”

entry.def: Very well is used to say that you agree to do something or you accept someone's answer, even though you might not be completely satisfied with it.
entry.tran: 那好吧，行（用于表示同意或接受，即使不是完全满意）

example.ex: 'We need proof, sir.' Another pause. Then, 'Very well.'...
example.tran: “我们需要证据，先生。”又是一个短暂停顿。然后，“那好吧。”

example.ex: Very well, please yourself.
example.tran: 好的，你自己随意。

entry.def: If you say that you cannot very well do something, you mean that it would not be right or possible to do it.

example.ex: He couldn't very well go to her office and force her to write a check...
example.tran: 他不能去她的办公室强迫她开支票。

example.ex: I said yes. I can't very well say no.
example.tran: 我答应了。我没法拒绝。
